Major_Arcs.title: Saloon Scene and Initial Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting in a saloon and establishes initial character dynamics and romantic undertones through conversations and interactions.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Atmosphere and Blonde Woman's Explanation
sub_scenes.description: The scene opens in a saloon, setting the stage and introducing characters, followed by a focused conversation with a blonde woman explaining her situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Scene Setting
The Blonde Woman's Explanation
Conversation Continues - Man's Response and Old Timers' Wisdom

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on the first page and contribute to establishing the initial setting, atmosphere, and introducing early character interactions and dialogues within the saloon.

Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town Demolition and Emotional Reactions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the conflict of modern development encroaching on the Ghost Town, focusing on the arrival of surveyors and the emotional responses to the planned demolition.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy's Farewell, Modern Arrival, and Demolition Plan
sub_scenes.description: A cowboy reflects on the past Ghost Town, contrasted by the arrival of modern surveyors who reveal their plan to demolish the town for an airport.

narrative_arcs.title: Cowboy's Farewell and Nostalgic Reflection
Modern Arrival and Ghost Town Observation
Airport Plan and Town Demolition Imminent
Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town's Destruction

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 2 and revolve around the introduction of the Ghost Town demolition plot and the initial reactions to this plan by different characters.

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Relationship Turmoil Amidst Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the personal relationship conflict between Nan and Cal, set against the backdrop of the ongoing Ghost Town demolition.

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Argument and Woman's Distress at Demolition
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal about their relationship, followed by a woman's emotional outburst against the Ghost Town demolition, highlighting personal and environmental conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Accusation and Cal's Defense
Woman's Reflection on Past Relationship with Cal
Ghost Town Demolition and Woman's Outburst

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 3 and intertwine the personal conflict between Nan and Cal with the external conflict of the Ghost Town demolition, showing different emotional responses to these situations.

sub_scenes.title: Business Matters, Father-Daughter Conflict, and Parental Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about cattle and the airport lead to a father-daughter conflict regarding horses for construction, followed by parental and maid's reassurance to Nan about Cal's love.

narrative_arcs.title: Cattle Shipping and Airport Business Discussion
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Conflict
Reassurance of Cal's Love

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 4 and the beginning of 5, focusing on business-related conversations, escalating into a father-daughter conflict, and then shifting to parental figures reassuring Nan about her relationship with Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Resolve and Business Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to seek clarity from Cal, initiating a chase that is interrupted by her father's business instructions, diverting her attention to a horse delivery task.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Resolve to Seek Clarity
Chasing Cal
Horse Business Interruption
Business Deal and Commitment

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they occur on page 5, showing Nan's shift from internal resolve to outward action, which is then interrupted and redirected by business obligations imposed by her father.

Major_Arcs.title: Cal's Departure, Return, and the Approaching Snowstorm
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the fluctuating relationship between Nan and Cal, marked by his departure and eventual return, all under the looming threat of a severe snowstorm.

sub_scenes.title: Intense Conversation, Cal's Departure and Nan's Longing
sub_scenes.description: An intense conversation leads to Cal's departure, followed by Nan's reaction to departing horses and a time skip showing her prolonged longing for Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Intense Conversation and Impending Departure
Cal's Departure
Reaction to Departing Horses
Time Skip and Nan's Longing Narration

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on page 6, depicting the culmination of conflict between Nan and Cal leading to his departure, and then focusing on Nan's emotional state during his absence.

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Return, Confession, and Weather Warning
sub_scenes.description: Cal returns and confesses his love, followed by a shift to a snowy setting and a weather report warning of severe conditions.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Return and Confession of Love
Reunion and Unease in the Snow
Arrival at the Snowy Homestead and Weather Report
Concern Over Livestock and Fodder Shortage
Assessing the Snow's Severity and Nan's Concern
Narrative Description of Relentless Snowfall
Cal's Decisive Action to Save the Cattle

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on pages 6 and 7, transitioning from the resolution of Nan and Cal's romantic tension to the introduction and escalation of the snowstorm crisis and Cal's response to it.

Major_Arcs.title: Snowstorm Relief and Romantic Reaffirmation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the resolution of the snowstorm crisis with the arrival of fodder and culminates in a romantic reaffirmation between Nan and Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Romantic Resolution Amidst Snow
sub_scenes.description: Initial despair due to the snowstorm is replaced by hope with the arrival of a plane carrying fodder, leading to a romantic resolution between Nan and Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Despair and a Glimmer of Hope
Plane Arrives with Fodder
Hope and Romantic Reassurance

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 8 and depict the emotional journey from despair caused by the snowstorm to hope and relief with the arrival of fodder, culminating in a romantic resolution between Nan and Cal against this backdrop.

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Showdown and Jeff's Gun Obsession
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the setting to Cowtown and introduces a new character, Chane Benson, involved in a showdown, and then transitions to focus on Jeff's concerning obsession with guns.

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Showdown and Reactions
sub_scenes.description: A showdown in Cowtown featuring Chane Benson and reactions from onlookers lead into a debate about Benson's character.

narrative_arcs.title: Showdown and Reactions in Cowtown
Debate on Chane Benson's Character
Dismissive Reaction and Age Critique

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on page 9 and introduce the setting of Cowtown, the character of Chane Benson through a showdown, and initial public reactions and judgments about him.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Sally's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's childhood and current gun obsession, leading to a direct confrontation about his behavior and admiration for Clyde Surratt, culminating in a violent threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Reminiscing About Jeff's Childhood
Gun Obsession Critique
Confrontation over Gun Cleaning
Lectures and Disobedience
Plea for Decency
Clyde Surratt Admiration
Boasting and Challenge to Clyde Surratt
Violent Threat and Laughter

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped together as they all occur on page 10 and center around Sally's concern and confrontation with Jeff regarding his gun obsession and admiration for figures like Clyde Surratt, escalating to Jeff's violent outburst.

Major_Arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff and Benson's Unsettling Demeanor
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Sally and Pete's plan to help Jeff and further develops the unsettling character of Chane Benson through narrative description.

sub_scenes.title: Planning Intervention for Jeff and Benson's Description
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Pete discuss and plan how to help Jeff, followed by a narrative description of Chane/Shane Benson's unsettling demeanor.

narrative_arcs.title: Planning to Help Jeff
Reaffirming Love and Duty Towards Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Sarcastic Remark
Narrative Reflection on Shane Benson's Demeanor

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 11, focusing on Sally and Pete's collaborative effort to address Jeff's issues and then shifting to a narrative focus on describing and characterizing Shane Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: Article Controversy and Benson Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around the controversy caused by an article written by Clyde about Chane Benson, leading to Sally's fear and Benson's confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Fallout and Benson's Response
sub_scenes.description: The aftermath of Clyde's article about Chane Benson is explored, showing Sally's fear and Clyde's reassurance, culminating in Benson's direct confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation about the Article
Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
Benson's Confrontation and Justification for Staying

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 12 and deal with the immediate consequences and reactions to Clyde's article about Benson, leading to a direct confrontation between Sally, Clyde, and Benson himself.

sub_scenes.title: Debating Benson's Character and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: The debate continues about Benson's character, leading to Sally and Surrett considering and eventually deciding to invite Benson for dinner to better understand him.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson Justifies His Stance and Criticizes Clyde
Sally and Surrett Discuss Clyde's Article and Benson's Impact
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Discussing Chane's Skills and Dinner Invitation

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 13 and follow the immediate confrontation with Benson, focusing on Sally and Surrett's private discussion and decision-making process regarding inviting Benson to dinner to assess his character.

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner with Benson and Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the dinner with Chane Benson, which quickly turns sour as Jeff's jealousy erupts into a violent confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Polite Dinner and Jeff's Jealousy
sub_scenes.description: A polite conversation during dinner transitions into an outdoor moonlit scene, quickly disrupted by Jeff's jealous confrontation of Sally and Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Polite Conversation and Departure for Moonlight Walk
Jeff's Jealous Confrontation
Escalating Aggression and Unwanted Kiss
Sally's Angry Retort and Accusations

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 14 and depict the escalating tension during the dinner invitation, starting with polite conversation and quickly devolving into Jeff's jealous and aggressive confrontation and Sally's angry reaction.

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath of Kiss and Ride to Save Clyde
sub_scenes.description: The aftermath of Jeff's aggressive actions leads to explanations, Chane's retaliation, and Sally and Jeff's urgent ride to save Clyde from Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Kiss Conversation and Jeff's Justification
Chane's Retaliation and Threat, Sally's Urgent Plea
Desperate Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation Inside the Newspaper Office

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on page 15, showing the immediate fallout of Jeff's violent outburst, including explanations, Chane's reaction and threat to Clyde, and then focusing on the urgent action of riding to save Clyde from Chane's threat.

Major_Arcs.title: Resolution of Benson Conflict and Newspaper Partnership
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the conflict with Chane Benson, showing his departure and leading into a flashback revealing the positive outcome of the newspaper partnership between Clyde and Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Departure and Newspaper's Future
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson departs with Clyde, followed by Sally and Jeff's anxious wait and Sally's order to change the headline, leading to a flashback about the newspaper's future.

narrative_arcs.title: Benson's Challenge and Chane's Departure with Clyde
Anxious Wait and Sally's Regret
Headline Change Order
Newspaper Partnership and Sally's Pride

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 16 and resolve the immediate conflict with Chane Benson by depicting his departure, followed by a reflection on the aftermath and then shifting to a positive flashback showcasing the newspaper's future success and the partnership between Clyde and Jeff.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Introduction of Steve Daley
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc transitions to a new storyline focusing on ranch troubles and introduces the character Steve Daley as the new boss, creating new conflicts and dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Conflict and New Boss Arrival
sub_scenes.description: A ranch conflict is introduced, followed by the arrival and introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss, raising questions and potential future conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Gender Insult
Introduction of Steve Daley as the Boss
Discussion of Trouble with the New Boss

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 17 and introduce a new ranch setting, initial conflict, and the arrival and introduction of Steve Daley as a significant new character and potential source of further conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Unease and Ranch Suspicions
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's initial interactions with Steve lead to her expressing unease about him, followed by a discussion about ranch troubles and suspicions of 'Double K'.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Interaction and Betsy's Unease with Steve
Ranch Troubles and Suspicions of Double K
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Betsy

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 18 and focus on Betsy's initial reaction and growing unease about Steve Daley, transitioning into a discussion about ranch problems and setting up a trip to town with Steve.

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Romance and Ranch Conflict Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc develops the romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve, amidst ranch conflicts and culminating in a confession of love and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Bar Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy faces confrontation in town, followed by a separate scene of a bar fight illustrating the volatile environment.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges at the Store
Bar Fight and Aftermath

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on page 19, depicting Betsy's confrontation in town and then introducing a separate bar fight scene that may indirectly reflect the overall tense atmosphere and violence.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Realization, Change of Heart and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's realization about Steve, a change of heart regarding firing him, and culminates in Betsy confessing her love to Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization about Steve and Ranch Decision
Betsy's Change of Heart and Hank's Suggestion
Betsy's Confession to Steve
Negotiating Terms and Gunfighter Identity
Love Confession and a Difficult Request
The Ultimate Proof of Love and a Kiss

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 20 and 21, tracing Betsy's evolving understanding and feelings towards Steve, leading to her confession of love and the resolution of their romantic tension through Steve's commitment to give up his gun.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Impending Violence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details a ranch confrontation with Old Man Bridges, escalating into threats and foreshadowing potential violence and conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Dispute and Escalating Threats
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges arrives with accusations, leading to escalating threats and Betsy's firm stance, foreshadowing potential violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Demands at the Ranch
Escalating Threats and Betsy's Firm Stance
Reflection on Violence and Foreshadowing of Attack
Betsy's Plea and Hank's Determination
Desperate Plea and Steve's Resolve
Betsy's Contemplation and Impending Action
Ride to Devil's Pass and Ceasefire

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 22 and 23, depicting the escalating ranch conflict initiated by Old Man Bridges, the increasing tension and threats, and Betsy and Steve's reactions and preparations for a confrontation at Devil's Pass.

Major_Arcs.title: Showdown at Devil's Pass and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc culminates in the showdown at Devil's Pass, featuring violence and danger but ultimately leading to a romantic reunion between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation at Devil's Pass unfolds with capture, violence, and ultimately a reunion and romantic resolution between Betsy and Steve after near-death experiences.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Initial Confrontation
Capture, Debate, and Shooting of Steve
Betsy's Faint and Reunion with Steve
Relief and Reflection on Survival
Romantic Declaration and Future Together

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 24 and depict the climactic showdown at Devil's Pass, featuring capture, violence, and the emotional resolution with Betsy and Steve's reunion and romantic affirmation amidst the danger.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch History and Fence Line Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a new ranch-related conflict involving fencing and range disputes, starting with Dave's sulking and transitioning into a flashback revealing the origins of the fence conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Dave's Sulking and Flashback to Fence Dispute Origin
sub_scenes.description: A scene of Dave sulking leads into a flashback narrated by a woman, revealing the origins of a fence dispute and the arrival of Curley with news of range trouble.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Sulking and Rebuke
Flashback to Curley's Arrival at the Corral
News of Fencing and Range Trouble

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they occur on page 25, starting with a present-day scene of Dave sulking and then transitioning into a flashback that provides the background and context for the fence dispute and range trouble.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Line Confrontation and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The ranchers discuss the impact of the fence, leading to a confrontation at the fence line with Fred Gordon, culminating in Curley's intervention and the expulsion of Fred Gordon and his brother.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranchers Discuss the New Fence
Confrontation at the Fence Line
Planning to Secure the Herd
Escalating Tension with Fred Gordon
Curley Intervenes to Prevent Violence
Disarming and Expulsion of Fred Gordon and Brother
Aftermath and Assertion of Ranch Ownership

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 26 and depict the escalating conflict at the fence line, starting with discussion and planning, moving into direct confrontation with Fred Gordon, and culminating in Curley's intervention and the expulsion of Fred and his brother, resolving the immediate fence line dispute.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Entanglements and Resolution with Fred and Carrie
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic entanglements of Carrie, Dave, and Fred, leading to confessions, misunderstandings, and ultimately, a marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred's Romantic Confessions
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave discuss their feelings and Fred, leading to Carrie and Fred's romantic confessions and developing relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Reluctant Friendship and Brotherly Disdain
Defense of Fred's Actions and Implicit Feelings
Confession of Conflicted Feelings
Seeking Honesty and Deeper Conversation
Affirmation of the Current Relationship
Internal Monologue of Perceived Unspoken Love
Sudden Interruption and Confrontational Inquiry
Accusation and Defensive Stance
Attempt to De-escalate and Initial Refusal
Accusation of Heartbreak and Questioning Conclusions
Declaration of Possessiveness and Protectiveness
Confession of Love Trigger and Reassurance
Brotherly Reconciliation and Movie Invitation
Flashback of Budding Romance and Anticipation
Marriage Proposal and Acceptance

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 27 and 28, tracing the complex romantic interactions and confessions between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, starting from Carrie and Dave's conversation about Fred and ultimately culminating in Fred's marriage proposal to Carrie.

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Misunderstanding and Emotional Fallout
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the misunderstanding surrounding the Carlton contract, leading to emotional turmoil and a confrontation with Mr. Carlton.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Revelation and Carrie's Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Misunderstandings about Dave's feelings and the Carlton contract are clarified, leading to Carrie feeling betrayed and confronting Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Misinterpretation Regarding Dave's Feelings
Clarification of Misunderstanding and Business Motives
Revelation of Selfishness and Business Priority
Angry Accusation of Deception and Trickery
Desperate Plea and Rejection of Affection
Internal Reflection on Suspicion and Motivation
Confrontation and Inquiry about Intentions

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 29, revealing Fred's and Dave's perspective on the Carlton contract and leading to Carrie's angry reaction and feelings of betrayal, setting up a confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Carlton and Emotional Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Carrie prepares for and directly confronts Mr. Carlton, followed by an emotional aftermath and reconciliation with Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Anticipation and Impatience Before Confrontation
Direct Confrontation with Mr. Carlton
Accusation of Trickery and Business Betrayal
Defiant Assertion of Independence and Self-Reliance
Emotional Aftermath and Reflection of Foolishness
Reconciliation and Comfort in Affection

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 30 and depict Carrie's preparation for and execution of a confrontation with Mr. Carlton regarding the contract misunderstanding, followed by the emotional fallout and reconciliation with Dave in the aftermath.

Major_Arcs.title: Departure, Reunion, and Lingering Emotions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc deals with Carrie's decision to leave, her reunion with Dave, and the lingering emotional complexities in her relationships.

sub_scenes.title: Departure Decision and Town Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie decides to leave the West, followed by a town reunion with Dave after weeks of separation.

narrative_arcs.title: Relief and Lingering Pain After Decision
Distant Reunion in Town After Weeks Apart
Inquiry and Confirmation of Love
Riding Back and Discussing Past and Present Feelings

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 31, depicting Carrie's decision to leave the West, her emotional state, and her reunion with Dave in town after a period of separation, leading to a conversation about their feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Illness and Fred's Brother's Search
sub_scenes.description: Carrie is shown ill, and Mr. Carlton reveals that Fred has sent his brother to find her, indicating concern and a potential misunderstanding.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Arrival of Visitors
Father's Scolding about Beef Contract
Confrontation and Unhappiness Regarding a Promise
Reflection, Embrace, and Reconciliation

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 32, depicting Carrie's illness and vulnerability, a family dispute about the beef contract, and then transitioning to a reconciliation and romantic resolution with Fred, addressing misunderstandings.

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Injury and Marshal's Pursuit
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new storyline focused on Dirk's injury and the Marshal's pursuit, introducing a new set of characters and conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Initial Response
sub_scenes.description: Chris is alerted by Dirk's actions, leading to the discovery of Dirk's gunshot wound and initial medical assessment.

narrative_arcs.title: Bedroom Interruption and Urgent Summons
Discovery of Gunshot Wound and Reassurance
Discussion about Dirk's Fight and Empty Gun
Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Ranch Confrontation

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 33 and 34, initiating a new storyline with Dirk's injury, the discovery of it, and the arrival of Marshal Rance Cready at the ranch, setting up a new conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Duty and Decision to Help Dirk
sub_scenes.description: The Marshal arrives, leading to a debate about duty and justice, culminating in the Marshal deciding to stay and help Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Man and Introduction of Dirk's Situation
Debate on Duty, Justice, and Decision to Stay for Dirk

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 35, focusing on the Marshal's arrival, the conversation about Dirk's situation, and the Marshal's internal conflict and eventual decision to stay and help Dirk, deviating from strict legal duty.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Reconciliation and Urgent Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc features a romantic reconciliation between Chris and Rance, immediately followed by an urgent plea and plan to rescue Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Reconciliation and Rescue Urgency
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance reconcile romantically, but their moment is interrupted by the urgent need to rescue Dirk, leading to planning and action.

narrative_arcs.title: Romantic Reconciliation after Argument
Urgent Plea to Rescue Dirk
Contemplating Rescue Strategy and Legal Implications

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 36, showcasing the romantic reconciliation between Chris and Rance, which is immediately followed by the introduction of a new, urgent conflict – the need to rescue Dirk, shifting the narrative focus from romance to action and rescue planning.

Major_Arcs.title: Escape, Confrontation, and Dirk's Capture
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Dirk's escape attempt, the relentless pursuit by the Marshal, their confrontation, and ultimately Dirk's capture.

sub_scenes.title: Escape Attempt and Persistent Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and his companions attempt to escape, but the Marshal's relentless pursuit makes evasion impossible.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape and Pursuit Begins
Failed Evasion and Pursuit Persistence
Confrontation, Shooting, and Aid
Disagreement on Fate of the Marshal
Departure and Difficult Decision
Confession of Love and Understanding
Rance's Defiance and Acceptance of Escape
Marshal's Plan, Dirk's Capture and Backstory Revealed

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 37, 38 and 40, detailing Dirk's attempt to escape the Marshal, the persistent chase, the violent confrontation and shooting incident, the moral dilemma about the Marshal's fate, and ultimately Dirk's capture, resolved by the Marshal's plan and revealed backstory.

Major_Arcs.title: Rance's Recovery and Romantic Proposal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Rance's recovery from his injuries and the culmination of the romantic storyline with Chris proposing marriage to him.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers from his injuries, leading to a doctor's visit and Chris confessing her love and proposing marriage to Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Awakening and Father's Relief
Doctor's Inquiry and Father's Explanation
Confession and Proposal
Mary and Chris's Confessions and Fears
Wedding Day is Here, but Dirk is Missing
Dirk Interrupts the Wedding and Confrontation

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they span pages 39 and 40, depicting Rance's recovery, the medical check-up, and then focusing on the romantic resolution with Chris's proposal and the lead up to the wedding day, which is then dramatically interrupted by Dirk.

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Disruption and Dirk's Capture
sub_scenes.description: Dirk dramatically interrupts the wedding, but his attempt to confront Rance is quickly thwarted by the Marshal's planned intervention, leading to Dirk's capture and the revelation of his backstory.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk Interrupts the Wedding and Confrontation
Marshal's Plan, Dirk's Capture and Backstory Revealed

sub_scenes.justification: These arcs are grouped as they all occur on page 40, depicting the dramatic disruption of the wedding by Dirk, his confrontation with Rance, and the swift resolution with Dirk's capture, along with the reveal of the backstory explaining the Marshal's actions and Dirk's past.
